channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report E-2023110084
item.description:
Report E-2023110084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: WILSON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2023, four (4) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were damaged during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Eastern Environmental Management (EEM) to remediate the impacted site. EEM personnel collected four (4) damaged one-gallon pails of UN1263 for disposal. Crews then utilized a pressure washer to alleviate staining to the extent practicable. All UN1263 impacted material and rinsate were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023100650
item.description:
Report X-2023100650

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON DOCK WITH A WET OUTER BOX. IT WAS PLACED BY THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOX HAD A VISIBLE HOLE IN THE SIDE OF IT APPROXIMATELY 4" IN DIAMETER. ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING THE LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS CHECKED TO B SURE IT WAS NOT LEAKING, THE PACKAGE WAS KEPT RIGHT SIDE UP.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA. The package was placed in a tote with a plastic bag. DescribePack: Upon investigation the outside of the package was wet, discovered the cap was loose on the container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside of a tote and placed inside a plastic bag

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA from the unload. The container was placed in a tote and plastic bag for Hazmat team to investigate DescribePack: After investigating the package notice the cap was loose and the box was wet DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in tote and plastic bag to prevent further leakage

item.title: Report X-2023100544
item.description:
Report X-2023100544

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS FOUND AT 281 DAMAGE QA AREA IN A HAZMAT BAG. UNSURE ON WHEN THE BAG WAS DROPPED OFF THERE. LAST SCANS ARE CHAR 282 SCANS. PKG WAS MOVED AND SECURED FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: APPEARS 1 OF THE JUGS HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED EMPTY INTO THE BOX DURING THE RTS PROCESSING. OTHER JUG APPEARS TO BE FINE. NO LEAKING OR LOOSE CAP ISSUES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS REMOVED FROM THE QA DAMAGE AREA AND SECURED TILL PERSONNEL WAS AVAILBLE TO PROCESS AND INSPECT FURTHER.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on dock with wet external packaging. Package was placed into plastic salvage drum. DescribePack: One plastic bottle, inside the package, had lose cap causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic hazardous waste bag, and then into a plastic hazardous drum.

item.title: Report X-2023100284
item.description:
Report X-2023100284

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the cap came off one of the plastic jugs of degreaser causing the contents to spill. The only packaging was a corrugated liner. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023100283
item.description:
Report X-2023100283

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the lid on the plastic pail of oxidizing shock pool powder was loose causing some of the contents to spill. There was no packaging in the box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.
